period.name: Human prehistory
period.text: Timeline from the evolution of modern humans to the invention of writing. All dates are approximate and conjectural, obtained through research in the fields of anthropology, archaeology, genetics, geology, or linguistics. They are all subject to revision due to new discoveries or improved calculations.

event.text: Late neolithic civilizations, invention of the wheel and spread of proto-writing.
Jiahu culture began in china
Çatal höyük urban settlement founded in anatolia

In northern mesopotamia, now northern iraq, cultivation of barley and wheat begins. at first they are used for beer, gruel, and soup, eventually for bread. in early agriculture at this time, the planting stick is used, but it is repltaced by a primitive plow in subsequent centuries. around this time, a round stone tower, now preserved to about 8.5 meters high and 8.5 meters in diameter is built in jericho.
Emergence of jericho, which is now one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.

Land ice leaves denmark and southern sweden; start of the current holocene epoch and neolithic age and end of the last ice age. invention of agriculture is the earliest given date for the beginning of the ancient era
The humid period begins in north africa. the region that would later become the sahara is wet and fertile, and the aquifers are full.
Wisent sculpted in clay deep inside the cave now known as le tuc d'audoubert in the french pyrenees near what is now the border of spain.
Chatelperronian culture in france.
Last glacial maximum
The oldest known tally stick (the ishango bone)

First colonisation of north america. a hamlet consisting of huts built of rocks and of mammoth bones is founded in what is now dolni vestonice in moravia in the czech republic. this is the oldest human permanent settlement that has yet been found by archaeologists.
Women around the world use fibers to make baby-carriers, clothes, bags, baskets, and nets.
Gravettian period in europe. harpoons, needles, and saws invented.
New guinea is populated by colonists from asia or australia.
Extinction of homo neanderthalensis.
Approximate age of haplogroup x (mtdna) and haplogroup i (mtdna). a herd of reindeer is slaughtered and butchered by humans in the vezere valley in what is today france.
Oldest known cave paintings
Aurignacian culture begins in europe.
Oldest known figurative art (venus of hohle fels), age of the aurignacian culture
Cro-magnon colonisation of europe (upper paleolithic)

Modern humans spread from asia to the near east; age of haplogroup b (mtdna) in the next millennia, these human group's descendants move on to southern india, the malay islands, australia, japan, china, siberia, alaska, and the northwestern coast of north america.
Out of africa migration of modern humans; approximate age of haplogroup n (mtdna), haplogroup c (mtdna) and haplogroup a (mtdna)
Toba volcano supereruption.
Approximate age of haplogroup m (mtdna)
Time of y-chromosomal adam
Earliest estimate for the domestication of dogs
Peak of the eemian stage interglacial
Time of mitochondrial eve
Split between homo sapiens idaltu and homo sapiens sapiens
Appearance of homo sapiens in africa

period.name: Human evolution
period.text: Time from the earliest common ancestor of humans and chimpanzees to the emergence of modern humans

event.text: Appearance of homo neanderthalensis
Homo sapiens separated from homo erectus (middle paleolithic); approximate age of canis lupus
Colonisation of eurasia by homo erectus
Last reversal of the earth's magnetic field
Earliest demonstrable evidence of the controlled use of fire by homo erectus
Earliest possible evidence of the controlled use of fire by homo erectus
Start of the pleistocene epoch and the current quaternary period; emergence of the genus homo
Current ice age begins
Appearance of the genus australopithecus
Pliocene epoch begins
Appearance of the genus ardipithecus
Estimated age of the homo/pan (human vs. chimpanzee) split, age of the hominini tribe
Estimated age of the hominidae/hylobatidae (great apes vs. gibbons) split.

period.name: Cenozoic
period.text: Time from the dawn of the Cenozoic era and the beginning of the age of mammals to the beginnings of human evolution

event.text: First forms of grass appear
Miocene epoch begins
Emergence of the first true elephants
Cats begin to evolve
End of eocene, start of oligocene epoch
Age of the catarrhini parvorder; first canines evolve
Whales return to the water
Divergence of cat and dog ancestors.
First known bats.
Evolution of the first primates and rodents.

period.name: Complex life
period.text: Time from the beginnings of complex, multicellular life to the beginning of the age of mammals

event.text: Cretaceous-tertiary extinction event at the end of the cretaceous period marks the end of the mesozoic era and the age of the dinosaurs; start of the tertiary period and the current cenozoic era.
End of jurassic and beginning of cretaceous period. first birds.
End of triassic and beginning of jurassic period; first mammals.
First turtles
First crocodilians
Permian mass extinction. end of permian period and of the palaeozoic era. beginning of triassic period, the mesozoic era and of the age of the dinosaurs.
End of carboniferous and beginning of permian period.
The evolution of the first reptiles.
Beginning of the carboniferous and the end of devonian period
Beginning of the devonian and the end of the silurian period. first insects.
First creature took a breath of air
Beginning of the silurian and the end of the ordovician period
Beginning of the ordovician and the end of the cambrian period

Beginning of the cambrian period, the paleozoic era and the phanerozoic (current) eon. end of the ediacaran period, the proterozoic eon and the precambrian supereon. time since the cambrian explosion the emergence of most forms of complex life, including vertebrates, arthropods, echinoderms and molluscs.
Oldest animal fossils
End of a possible snowball earth ice age
First complex multicelled lifeforms
Beginning of the ediacaran period.

period.name: Formation of the Earth
period.text: Time since the formation of Earth to the beginnings of complex life

event.text: Beginning of a possible snowball earth ice age
Earliest eukaryotes
First known ice age
End of the archaean eon; beginning of the proterozoic eon
Age of the mare imbrium, the lower imbrian epoch
Origin of life (cyanobacteria). end of the hadean eon and beginning of the archaean eon.
Age of the earth (see: precambrian)

period.name: Formation of the universe
period.text: Time from the formation of the universe to the formation of the Earth

event.text: The solar system begins to form
Age of the oldest known star, he 1523-0901
Estimated age of the universe according to the big bang theory
